1.name: BULBASAUR
1.text: A strange seed was planted on its back at birth. The plant sprouts and grows with this #MON

2.name: IVYSAUR
2.text: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs

3.name: VENUSAUR
3.text: The plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight

4.name: CHARMANDER
4.text: Obviously prefers hot places. When it rains, steam is said to spout from the tip of its tail

5.name: CHARMELEON
5.text: When it swings its burning tail, it elevates the temperature to unbearably high levels

6.name: CHARIZARD
6.text: Spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. Known to cause forest fires unintentionally

7.name: SQUIRTLE
7.text: After birth, its back swells and hardens into a shell. Powerfully sprays foam from its mouth

8.name: WARTORTLE
8.text: Often hides in water to stalk unwary prey. For swimming fast, it moves its ears to maintain balance

9.name: BLASTOISE
9.text: A brutal #MON with pressurized water jets on its shell. They are used for high speed tackles

10.name: CATERPIE
10.text: Its short feet are tipped with suction pads that enable it to tirelessly climb slopes and walls

11.name: METAPOD
11.text: This #MON is vulnerable to attack while its shell is soft, exposing its weak and tender body

12.name: BUTTERFREE
12.text: In battle, it flaps its wings at high speed to release highly toxic dust into the air

13.name: WEEDLE
13.text: Often found in forests, eating leaves. It has a sharp venomous stinger on its head

14.name: KAKUNA
14.text: Almost incapable of moving, this #MON can only harden its shell to protect itself from predators

15.name: BEEDRILL
15.text: Flies at high speed and attacks using its large venomous stingers on its forelegs and tail

16.name: PIDGEY
16.text: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand

17.name: PIDGEOTTO
17.text: Very protective of its sprawling territorial area, this #MON will fiercely peck at any intruder

18.name: PIDGEOT
18.text: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as MAGIKARP

19.name: RATTATA
19.text: Bites anything when it attacks. Small and very quick, it is a common sight in many places

20.name: RATICATE
20.text: It uses its whis- kers to maintain its balance. It apparently slows down if they are cut off

21.name: SPEAROW
21.text: Eats bugs in grassy areas. It has to flap its short wings at high speed to stay airborne

22.name: FEAROW
22.text: With its huge and magnificent wings, it can keep aloft without ever having to land for rest

23.name: EKANS
23.text: Moves silently and stealthily. Eats the eggs of birds, such as PIDGEY and SPEAROW, whole

24.name: ARBOK
24.text: It is rumored that the ferocious warning markings on its belly differ from area to area

25.name: PIKACHU
25.text: When several of these #MON gather, their electricity could build and cause lightning storms

26.name: RAICHU
26.text: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power

27.name: SANDSHREW
27.text: Burrows deep underground in arid locations far from water. It only emerges to hunt for food

28.name: SANDSLASH
28.text: Curls up into a spiny ball when threatened. It can roll while curled up to attack or escape

29.name: NIDORAN♀
29.text: Although small, its venomous barbs render this #MON dangerous. The female has smaller horns

30.name: NIDORINA
30.text: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting

31.name: NIDOQUEEN
31.text: Its hard scales provide strong protection. It uses its hefty bulk to execute powerful moves

32.name: NIDORAN♂
32.text: Stiffens its ears to sense danger. The larger its horns, the more powerful its secreted venom

33.name: NIDORINO
33.text: An aggressive #MON that is quick to attack. The horn on its head secretes a powerful venom

34.name: NIDOKING
34.text: It uses its powerful tail in battle to smash, constrict, then break the prey's bones

35.name: CLEFAIRY
35.text: Its magical and cute appeal has many admirers. It is rare and found only in certain areas

36.name: CLEFABLE
36.text: A timid fairy #MON that is rarely seen. It will run and hide the moment it senses people

37.name: VULPIX
37.text: At the time of birth, it has just one tail. The tail splits from its tip as it grows older

38.name: NINETALES
38.text: Very smart and very vengeful. Grabbing one of its many tails could result in a 1000-year curse

39.name: JIGGLYPUFF
39.text: When its huge eyes light up, it sings a mysteriously soothing melody that lulls its enemies to sleep

40.name: WIGGLYTUFF
40.text: The body is soft and rubbery. When angered, it will suck in air and inflate itself to an enormous size

41.name: ZUBAT
41.text: Forms colonies in perpetually dark places. Uses ultrasonic waves to identify and approach targets

42.name: GOLBAT
42.text: Once it strikes, it will not stop draining energy from the victim even if it gets too heavy to fly

43.name: ODDISH
43.text: During the day, it keeps its face buried in the ground. At night, it wanders around sowing its seeds

44.name: GLOOM
44.text: The fluid that oozes from its mouth isn't drool. It is a nectar that is used to attract prey

45.name: VILEPLUME
45.text: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up

46.name: PARAS
46.text: Burrows to suck tree roots. The mushrooms on its back grow by draw- ing nutrients from the bug host

47.name: PARASECT
47.text: A host-parasite pair in which the parasite mushroom has taken over the host bug. Prefers damp places

48.name: VENONAT
48.text: Lives in the shadows of tall trees where it eats insects. It is attracted by light at night

49.name: VENOMOTH
49.text: The dust-like scales covering its wings are color coded to indicate the kinds of poison it has

50.name: DIGLETT
50.text: Lives about one yard underground where it feeds on plant roots. It sometimes appears above ground

51.name: DUGTRIO
51.text: A team of DIGLETT triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground

52.name: MEOWTH
52.text: Adores circular objects. Wanders the streets on a nightly basis to look for dropped loose change

53.name: PERSIAN
53.text: Although its fur has many admirers, it is tough to raise as a pet because of its fickle meanness

54.name: PSYDUCK
54.text: While lulling its enemies with its vacant look, this wily #MON will use psychokinetic powers

55.name: GOLDUCK
55.text: Often seen swim- ming elegantly by lake shores. It is often mistaken for the Japanese monster, Kappa

56.name: MANKEY
56.text: Extremely quick to anger. It could be docile one moment then thrashing away the next instant

57.name: PRIMEAPE
57.text: Always furious and tenacious to boot. It will not abandon chasing its quarry until it is caught

58.name: GROWLITHE
58.text: Very protective of its territory. It will bark and bite to repel intruders from its space

59.name: ARCANINE
59.text: A #MON that has been admired since the past for its beauty. It runs agilely as if on wings

60.name: POLIWAG
60.text: Its newly grown legs prevent it from running. It appears to prefer swimming than trying to stand

61.name: POLIWHIRL
61.text: Capable of living in or out of water. When out of water, it sweats to keep its body slimy

62.name: POLIWRATH
62.text: An adept swimmer at both the front crawl and breast stroke. Easily overtakes the best human swimmers

63.name: ABRA
63.text: Using its ability to read minds, it will identify impending danger and TELEPORT to safety

64.name: KADABRA
64.text: It emits special alpha waves from its body that induce headaches just by being close by

65.name: ALAKAZAM
65.text: Its brain can out- perform a super- computer. Its intelligence quotient is said to be 5,000

66.name: MACHOP
66.text: Loves to build its muscles. It trains in all styles of martial arts to become even stronger

67.name: MACHOKE
67.text: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power save belt to be able to regulate its motions

68.name: MACHAMP
68.text: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon

69.name: BELLSPROUT
69.text: A carnivorous #MON that traps and eats bugs. It uses its root feet to soak up needed moisture

70.name: WEEPINBELL
70.text: It spits out POISONPOWDER to immobilize the enemy and then finishes it with a spray of ACID

71.name: VICTREEBEL
71.text: Said to live in huge colonies deep in jungles, although no one has ever returned from there

72.name: TENTACOOL
72.text: Drifts in shallow seas. Anglers who hook them by accident are often punished by its stinging acid

73.name: TENTACRUEL
73.text: The tentacles are normally kept short. On hunts, they are extended to ensnare and immobilize prey

74.name: GEODUDE
74.text: Found in fields and mountains. Mistaking them for boulders, people often step or trip on them

75.name: GRAVELER
75.text: Rolls down slopes to move. It rolls over any obstacle without slowing or changing its direction

76.name: GOLEM
76.text: Its boulder-like body is extremely hard. It can easily withstand dynamite blasts without damage

77.name: PONYTA
77.text: Its hooves are 10 times harder than diamonds. It can trample anything completely flat in little time

78.name: RAPIDASH
78.text: Very competitive, this #MON will chase anything that moves fast in the hopes of racing it

79.name: SLOWPOKE
79.text: Incredibly slow and dopey. It takes 5 seconds for it to feel pain when under attack

80.name: SLOWBRO
80.text: The SHELLDER that is latched onto SLOWPOKE's tail is said to feed on the host's left over scraps

81.name: MAGNEMITE
81.text: Uses anti-gravity to stay suspended. Appears without warning and uses THUNDER WAVE and similar moves

82.name: MAGNETON
82.text: Formed by several MAGNEMITEs linked together. They frequently appear when sunspots flare up

83.name: FARFETCH'D
83.text: The sprig of green onions it holds is its weapon. It is used much like a metal sword

84.name: DODUO
84.text: A bird that makes up for its poor flying with its fast foot speed. Leaves giant footprints

85.name: DODRIO
85.text: Uses its three brains to execute complex plans. While two heads sleep, one head stays awake

86.name: SEEL
86.text: The protruding horn on its head is very hard. It is used for bashing through thick ice

87.name: DEWGONG
87.text: Stores thermal energy in its body. Swims at a steady 8 knots even in intensely cold waters

88.name: GRIMER
88.text: Appears in filthy areas. Thrives by sucking up polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories

89.name: MUK
89.text: Thickly covered with a filthy, vile sludge. It is so toxic, even its footprints contain poison

90.name: SHELLDER
90.text: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open

91.name: CLOYSTER
91.text: When attacked, it launches its horns in quick volleys. Its innards have never been seen

92.name: GASTLY
92.text: Almost invisible, this gaseous #MON cloaks the target and puts it to sleep without notice

93.name: HAUNTER
93.text: Because of its ability to slip through block walls, it is said to be from an- other dimension

94.name: GENGAR
94.text: Under a full moon, this #MON likes to mimic the shadows of people and laugh at their fright

95.name: ONIX
95.text: As it grows, the stone portions of its body harden to become similar to a diamond, but colored black

96.name: DROWZEE
96.text: Puts enemies to sleep then eats their dreams. Occasionally gets sick from eating bad dreams

97.name: HYPNO
97.text: When it locks eyes with an enemy, it will use a mix of PSI moves such as HYPNOSIS and CONFUSION

98.name: KRABBY
98.text: Its pincers are not only powerful weapons, they are used for balance when walking sideways

99.name: KINGLER
99.text: The large pincer has 10000 hp of crushing power. However, its huge size makes it unwieldy to use

100.name: VOLTORB
100.text: Usually found in power plants. Easily mistaken for a # BALL, they have zapped many people

101.name: ELECTRODE
101.text: It stores electric energy under very high pressure. It often explodes with little or no provocation

102.name: EXEGGCUTE
102.text: Often mistaken for eggs. When disturbed, they quickly gather and attack in swarms

103.name: EXEGGUTOR
103.text: Legend has it that on rare occasions, one of its heads will drop off and continue on as an EXEGGCUTE

104.name: CUBONE
104.text: Because it never removes its skull helmet, no one has ever seen this #MON's real face

105.name: MAROWAK
105.text: The bone it holds is its key weapon. It throws the bone skillfully like a boomerang to KO targets

106.name: HITMONLEE
106.text: When in a hurry, its legs lengthen progressively. It runs smoothly with extra long, loping strides

107.name: HITMONCHAN
107.text: While apparently doing nothing, it fires punches in lightning fast volleys that are impossible to see

108.name: LICKITUNG
108.text: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies

109.name: KOFFING
109.text: Because it stores several kinds of toxic gases in its body, it is prone to exploding without warning

110.name: WEEZING
110.text: Where two kinds of poison gases meet, 2 KOFFINGs can fuse into a WEEZING over many years

111.name: RHYHORN
111.text: Its massive bones are 1000 times harder than human bones. It can easily knock a trailer flying

112.name: RHYDON
112.text: Protected by an armor-like hide, it is capable of living in molten lava of 3,600 degrees

113.name: CHANSEY
113.text: A rare and elusive #MON that is said to bring happiness to those who manage to get it

114.name: TANGELA
114.text: The whole body is swathed with wide vines that are similar to sea- weed. Its vines shake as it walks

115.name: KANGASKHAN
115.text: The infant rarely ventures out of its mother's protective pouch until it is 3 years old

116.name: HORSEA
116.text: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water

117.name: SEADRA
117.text: Capable of swim- ming backwards by rapidly flapping its wing-like pectoral fins and stout tail

118.name: GOLDEEN
118.text: Its tail fin billows like an elegant ballroom dress, giving it the nickname of the Water Queen

119.name: SEAKING
119.text: In the autumn spawning season, they can be seen swimming power- fully up rivers and creeks

120.name: STARYU
120.text: An enigmatic #MON that can effortlessly regenerate any appendage it loses in battle

121.name: STARMIE
121.text: Its central core glows with the seven colors of the rainbow. Some people value the core as a gem

122.name: MR.MIME
122.text: If interrupted while it is miming, it will slap around the offender with its broad hands

123.name: SCYTHER
123.text: With ninja-like agility and speed, it can create the illusion that there is more than one

124.name: JYNX
124.text: It seductively wiggles its hips as it walks. It can cause people to dance in unison with it

125.name: ELECTABUZZ
125.text: Normally found near power plants, they can wander away and cause major blackouts in cities

126.name: MAGMAR
126.text: Its body always burns with an orange glow that enables it to hide perfectly among flames

127.name: PINSIR
127.text: If it fails to crush the victim in its pincers, it will swing it around and toss it hard

128.name: TAUROS
128.text: When it targets an enemy, it charges furiously while whipping its body with its long tails

129.name: MAGIKARP
129.text: In the distant past, it was somewhat stronger than the horribly weak descendants that exist today

130.name: GYARADOS
130.text: Rarely seen in the wild. Huge and vicious, it is capable of destroying entire cities in a rage

131.name: LAPRAS
131.text: A #MON that has been over- hunted almost to extinction. It can ferry people across the water

132.name: DITTO
132.text: Capable of copying an enemy's genetic code to instantly transform itself into a duplicate of the enemy

133.name: EEVEE
133.text: Its genetic code is irregular. It may mutate if it is exposed to radiation from element STONEs

134.name: VAPOREON
134.text: Lives close to water. Its long tail is ridged with a fin which is often mistaken for a mermaid's

135.name: JOLTEON
135.text: It accumulates negative ions in the atmosphere to blast out 10000- volt lightning bolts

136.name: FLAREON
136.text: When storing thermal energy in its body, its temperature could soar to over 1600 degrees

137.name: PORYGON
137.text: A #MON that consists entirely of programming code. Capable of moving freely in cyberspace

138.name: OMANYTE
138.text: Although long extinct, in rare cases, it can be genetically resurrected from fossils

139.name: OMASTAR
139.text: A prehistoric #MON that died out when its heavy shell made it impossible to catch prey

140.name: KABUTO
140.text: A #MON that was resurrected from a fossil found in what was once the ocean floor eons ago

141.name: KABUTOPS
141.text: Its sleek shape is perfect for swim- ming. It slashes prey with its claws and drains the body fluids

142.name: AERODACTYL
142.text: A ferocious, pre- historic #MON that goes for the enemy's throat with its serrated saw-like fangs

143.name: SNORLAX
143.text: Very lazy. Just eats and sleeps. As its rotund bulk builds, it becomes steadily more slothful

144.name: ARTICUNO
144.text: A legendary bird #MON that is said to appear to doomed people who are lost in icy mountains

145.name: ZAPDOS
145.text: A legendary bird #MON that is said to appear from clouds while dropping enormous lightning bolts

146.name: MOLTRES
146.text: Known as the legendary bird of fire. Every flap of its wings creates a dazzling flash of flames

147.name: DRATINI
147.text: Long considered a mythical #MON until recently when a small colony was found living underwater

148.name: DRAGONAIR
148.text: A mystical #MON that exudes a gentle aura. Has the ability to change climate conditions

149.name: DRAGONITE
149.text: An extremely rarely seen marine #MON. Its intelligence is said to match that of humans

150.name: MEWTWO
150.text: It was created by a scientist after years of horrific gene splicing and DNA engineering experiments
